text: Jean Carlos Santiago Pérez (born September 16, 1992) known professionally as Guaynaa, is a Puerto Rican rapper. He is known for the song "ReBoTa", which became his first song to reach Billboard Hot Latin Songs in April, 2019. He is signed with American music label Universal Music. ==Biography== Guaynaa was born in Caguas, Puerto Rico. Before pursuing a musical career, he was working as a phone salesman in a mall. He was going to become a petrochemical engineer before working on music. His stage name originated from the nickname "guayna" given to him during rap competitions, which is Puerto Rican slang for a "wealthy, high-class snob". ==Career== He came to fame because of the song "ReBoTa", which reached number 35 on Billboard Hot Latin Songs chart in April 2019 and has received over 300 million views on Youtube. The song had a remix with Becky G, Farruko, Nicky Jam, and Sech in July 2019 and was later certified 4× Platinum by the RIAA's Latin division. After the success of "ReBoTa", he signed a joint record deal with Universal Music Latino and Republic Records. In August 2019, Guaynaa appeared on a remix of PJ Sin Suela's single "La Pelua" with Jon Z and Rafa Pabón. In October 2019, he collaborated with Spanish rapper Mala Rodríguez on the single "Dame Bien". In November 2019, he made a song with Yandel, saying that "it was dream come true". He also has collaborated with Mon Laferte, Maraiah, and others. In February 2020, he was nominated for Premios Heat along with Paloma Mami and Cami. ==Discography== *BRB Be Right Back (2020) ==References== Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Puerto Rican singers Category:People from Caguas, Puerto Rico
title: Guaynaa
